content.description: Starting on the same holds as the Shoot for the Moon Project, traverse left along jugs until you can make a reach up to the lip of the boulder, bring the feet up on big jugs all along the wall, topoout on jugs just to the right of the left arete.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the climb traverses a bit.
content.location: Starting on the same holds as the Shoot for the Moon Project, traverse left along jugs to the left arete of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the arete, move up and left using a crack for the left hand and bumping the right hand along the jug arete, bring the feet up into the small diehedral and then figure out a way to match the arete, from there you can layback the arete to an easy topout above the small tree growing out of the rock.
content.location: At the base of the arete on the right side of the Moonwalk boulder, next to small roof.

content.description: Shoot the Moon is a dyno problem in the middle of the Moonwalk wall, start matched on a jug at ~head height, pull on and place your feet wherever feels best, make a huge move straight up to jugs at the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 3+ pads, a bad fall could send you flying down the hillside.
content.location: In the middle of the Moonwalk wall, on obvious jugs under the steepest portion of the wall.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the arete, move up and left using a crack for the left hand and bumping the right hand along the jug arete, bring the feet up into the small dihedral and then figure out a way to match the arete, from there you can layback the arete and then traverse left just below the tree onto the main face of the boulder, continue traversing left into Under the Moon, continue on and finish up that climb.
content.location: Starting on the right arete of the boulder, and then moving low and left along the ~head height jug line all the way to the left arete of the boulder.

content.description: A moderately sized boulder at the top of the Hillside Zone. Mainly featured by good jug features that create several good traverses through the lower and higher tiers of the boulder.
